intro: Scabiosa mansenensis f. pinnata, commonly known as the pinnate scabious, is a rare and striking perennial plant native to specific regions of Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive pinnate (feather-like) leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry garden settings. Its unique foliage and delicate blooms make it a valuable addition to botanical collections and conservation efforts. Due to its limited natural range, it is often cultivated in specialized horticultural environments.
